channel.title: Help please?
channel.description:
Well, I followed all of the TuT's that I can find about Port-Forwarding, and yet I still can't Port-Forward. So I've went to my last straw and finally decided to post a topic on the boards. Anyways, here's the information that I think you'd need to help me.
My Router - [URL=http://imageshack.us][IMG]http://img251.imageshack.us/img251/3757/faer6ekr6.png[/img][/URL]
I can access my router, and go to Port-Forwarding and there's this [URL=http://imageshack.us][IMG]http://img410.imageshack.us/img410/6086/asfqp0.png[/img][/URL]
and when I go and choose Add Server this shows up [URL=http://imageshack.us][IMG]http://img61.imageshack.us/img61/5568/asdftt3.png[/img][/URL]
As you can see, I attempted to make my own network already. But when I had a friend of mine try to log into my server from Hamachi, he said it did not work so I really don't know what I am doing wrong.[br][size=1]Posted on: March 10, 2007, 04:45:29 PM[/size][hr]Anyone?[br][size=1]Posted on: March 10, 2007, 05:02:08 PM[/size][hr]Someone?

item.title: Help please?
item.dc:creator: @Tyler1993 Tyler1993
item.description:
@Tyler1993 wrote:

first u need to make a static ip…

and use like ur ip for ur router that u typed in at the top in address bar and for example: mine is 192.168.1.1 and i made it to 192.168.1.50

try subnet as 255.255.255.0 and gateway what u have at ur address bar ip

any service name and ports 43594 to 43594 and then the ip that u made like 192.168.1.50 like mine

try it

or go to your router website (netgear site) and try to live chat with them and ask them to tell you how to set a static ip and do port forwarding for a private server.

Read full topic
